You are a helpful assistant that map Python code and translated JavaScript code. 
For user requests, you output the mapping directly in consistent formats without explanations.
You should not make any changes to the provided code pair when you output the mapping. 
You can only add annotations at the end of the line for each statement.
You should not skip statements when you output the mapping.

### Python

```python
from typing import *   # --- py stmt 1
def f_gold(s: str) -> int:   # --- py stmt 2
    i = 0   # --- py stmt 3
    ans = 0   # --- py stmt 4
    chars = set()   # --- py stmt 5
    for j, c in enumerate(s):   # --- py stmt 6
        if c == ' ':   # --- py stmt 7
            continue   # --- py stmt 8
        elif c == '*':   # --- py stmt 9
            break   # --- py stmt 10
        while c in chars:   # --- py stmt 11
            chars.remove(s[i])   # --- py stmt 12
            i += 1   # --- py stmt 13
        chars.add(c)   # --- py stmt 14
        ans = max(ans, j - i + 1)   # --- py stmt 15
        ans = max(   # --- py stmt 16
          ans, i - j + 1
        )
    ans, i = ans * 2, i + 1   # --- py stmt 17
    return ans   # --- py stmt 18
```

### JavaScript

```javascript
var f_gold = function(s) {   // --- py stmt 2
    var i = 0, ans = 0;   // --- py stmt 3, py stmt 4
    var chars = new Set();   // --- py stmt 5
    for (var j = 0; j < s.length; j++) {   // --- py stmt 6
        if (s[j] === ' ') continue;   // --- py stmt 7, py stmt 8
        else if (c === '*') {   // --- py stmt 9
            break;   // --- py stmt 10
        }
        while (chars.has(s[j])) {   // --- py stmt 11
            chars.delete(s[i]);   // --- py stmt 12
            i++;   // --- py stmt 13
        }
        chars.add(s[j]);   // --- py stmt 14
        ans = Math.max(ans, j - i + 1);   // --- py stmt 15
        ans = Math.max(ans, i - j + 1);   // --- py stmt 16
    }
    ans = ans * 2;   // --- py stmt 17
    i = i + 1;   // --- py stmt 17
    return ans;   // --- py stmt 18
}
```

message.content:
### Python

```python
### highestPeak 
from collections import deque   # --- py stmt 1
from typing import *   # --- py stmt 2
def f_gold(isWater: List[List[int]]) -> List[List[int]]:   # --- py stmt 3
    m, n = len(isWater), len(isWater[0])   # --- py stmt 4
    ans = [[-1] * n for _ in range(m)]   # --- py stmt 5
    q = deque()   # --- py stmt 6
    for i in range(m):   # --- py stmt 7
        for j in range(n):   # --- py stmt 8
            if isWater[i][j] == 1:   # --- py stmt 9
                ans[i][j] = 0   # --- py stmt 10
                q.append((i, j))   # --- py stmt 11
    while q:   # --- py stmt 12
        i, j = q.popleft()   # --- py stmt 13
        for a, b in [[0, -1], [0, 1], [1, 0], [-1, 0]]:   # --- py stmt 14
            x, y = i + a, j + b   # --- py stmt 15
            if 0 <= x < m and 0 <= y < n and ans[x][y] == -1:   # --- py stmt 16
                ans[x][y] = ans[i][j] + 1   # --- py stmt 17
                q.append((x, y))   # --- py stmt 18
    return ans   # --- py stmt 19
```

### JavaScript

```javascript
function findDistancesFromWater(isWater) {   // --- py stmt 3
    var rows = isWater.length;   // --- py stmt 4
    var cols = isWater[0].length;   // --- py stmt 4
    var distances = new Array(rows);   // --- py stmt 5
    for (var i = 0; i < rows; i++) {   // --- py stmt 5
        distances[i] = new Array(cols);   // --- py stmt 5
        for (var j = 0; j < cols; j++) {   // --- py stmt 5
            distances[i][j] = -1;   // --- py stmt 5
        }
    }
    var queue = [];   // --- py stmt 6
    for (var i = 0; i < rows; i++) {   // --- py stmt 7
        for (var j = 0; j < cols; j++) {   // --- py stmt 8
            if (isWater[i][j] == 1) {   // --- py stmt 9
                distances[i][j] = 0;   // --- py stmt 10
                queue.push([i, j]);   // --- py stmt 11
            }
        }
    }
    while (queue.length > 0) {   // --- py stmt 12
        var i = queue[0][0];   // --- py stmt 13
        var j = queue[0][1];   // --- py stmt 13
        queue.shift();   // --- py stmt 13
        if (true) {   // --- py stmt 14
            for (var [a, b] of [[0, -1], [0, 1], [1, 0], [-1, 0]]) {   // --- py stmt 14
                var x = i + a;   // --- py stmt 15
                var y = j + b;   // --- py stmt 15
                if (0 <= x && x < rows && 0 <= y && y < cols && distances[x][y] == -1) {   // --- py stmt 16
                    distances[x][y] = distances[i][j] + 1;   // --- py stmt 17
                    queue.push([x, y]);   // --- py stmt 18
                }
            }
        }
    }
    return distances;   // --- py stmt 19
}
```
